snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index has fallen about 4 percent since reaching a record high on Sept. 18.
abstract: Signs that lawmakers are moving to end stalemate in Washington and avert federal government debt default halt slump in stock market.
lead_paragraph: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index has fallen about 4 percent since reaching a record high on Sept. 18.

headline.main: Wall St. Climbs as Hopes For Détente on Debt Emerge
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Climbs as Hopes For Détente on Debt Emerge
